text:
Kristoff tops the revenue list for the third year in a row
Cyclist Alexander Kristoff had the highest taxable income of Norwegian athletes who tax to Norway in 2018.
05 Nov 2019, 08:45 by NTB
It is the third year in a row that he has topped the list. He earned $ 13.5 million, according to figures from the Tax Administration, which were presented Tuesday morning. According to TV 2, the biathlon Tarjei B√∏ is the closest to the list. Big brother B√∏ had an income of almost NOK 9 million.
The list of top ten is dominated by winter athletes.
Here's the list:
1) Alexander Kristoff (cycling) NOK 13,508,855.
2) Tarjei B√∏ (biathlon) 8,980,937
3) Martin Johnsrud Sundby (cross country) 7,845,216
4) Johannes Thingnes B√∏ (biathlon) 6,574,511
5) Ole Gunnar Solskj√¶r (football) 6,419,368
6) Patrick Thoresen (ice hockey) 5,677,788
7) Kjetil Jansrud (alpine) 4,121,482
8) Marit Bj√∏rgen (cross country) 3,609,914
9) Therese Johaug (cross country) 3,432,155
10) Sander Sagosen (handball) 3,381,522.
There are 25 people who have an income of more than NOK 1 million. Gold Ball winner Ada Hegerberg is number 25 in the list with NOK 1,038,420.
As VG first mentioned, Therese Johaug tops the list of performers with the greatest wealth. The cross-country star was good for a total of NOK 49.2 million last year.
Number two on that list is Vipers keeper Katrine Lunde, with a registered fortune of $ 48.9 million. Ice hockey player Patrick Thoresen comes in third. He was registered with just over 48 million.


Vipers keeper Katrine Lunde was the Norwegian athlete registered in 2018 with the second biggest fortune.üì∑ Tor Erik Schr√∏der / NTB scanpix
